title: Implement version tracking system for template environments
description: Create a version tracking system that tracks both template version (this repo) and project version (instances using the template). Decide between semantic versioning (v1.0.0) vs date-based (2026-01-26). Create version file(s) likely at .claude/version.json for both lite/ and standard/ templates, plus root repo version.
completion_notes: Implemented hybrid versioning: semantic version (v1.0.0) + release date (2026-01-26). Created version.json at three levels: root (.claude/version.json), lite (lite/.claude/version.json), and standard (standard/.claude/version.json). Schema includes template_version, template_release_date, template_name, source_repo, project_version, project_initialized, and notes fields. Semantic versioning chosen for communicating breaking changes; date provides quick release reference.
notes: Key decision: semantic vs date-based versioning. Semantic (v1.2.3) better for breaking changes, date-based (2026-01-26) simpler for continuous evolution. Consider hybrid: v1.0.0-2026-01-26. Note: Root .claude/version.json tracks THIS REPO's version. Template versions (lite/, standard/) are what users copy - they track the template version the project was bootstrapped from.

assumptions.description: JSON format is appropriate for version tracking
Version file should be in .claude/ directory for consistency

decision_rationale: Hybrid versioning (semantic + date) provides the best of both approaches: semantic version communicates breaking vs non-breaking changes, while date provides quick reference for release timing. Consistent with modern tooling patterns.
